alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Inland Glynn; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Glynn, northeastern Brantley and eastern Wayne Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Everett, or 11 miles south of Gardi, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Gardi, Thalmann, Everett, Doctortown, Mount Pleasant, Hortense and Broadhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
